body.script:
var siteAlerts = [{"id":3825,"title":"School Closing","body":"
As our calendar indicates, our schools, as well as all charter schools will have their spring recess as scheduled, from April 9-April 17. Teachers will again provide instruction beginning April 20.\n
Como lo indica nuestro calendario, nuestras escuelas, así como todas las escuelas chárter tendrán su receso de primavera según lo programado, del 9 de abril al 17 de abril. Los maestros nuevamente brindarán instrucción a partir del 20 de abril.\n
\n
Governor Cuomo has announced that all schools will be closed until April 15 and he will then decide the date that schools reopen.\n
El Gobernador Cuomo ha anunciado que todas las escuelas estarán cerradas hasta el 15 de abril y luego decidirá la fecha en que las escuelas volverán a abrir.","dateStart":"2020-03-27T16:06:20Z","baseGroupName":"Icahn Charter Schools","hash":"BjrcliYLL6X4JRnYdO4C6cH6Ejkq6m6koYk0XV+GJDY=","updateDate":"2020-04-01T16:55:07Z"}];

img.div: Together We Can Achieve the Extraordinary

div.p: Superintendent: Jeffrey Litt
Deputy Superintendent: Daniel Garcia
Principal: Marcy Glattstein
Staff Developer: Nicole Patrignelli
Please click here to read a letter from Ms. Glattstein regarding Spring Recess.
Please read the latest letter from Mr. Litt regarding Spring Recess.
Click here for a letter to students from Mr. Litt
Mr. Litt's March letter to parents. Click here

Parents! Click here for Icahn's Remote Learning Update. In addition to the Remote Learning Plan, the document has information regarding Childcare for First Responders, Free Meals for Students, and Free/Low Cost Internet Options for families.

div.div: The City of New York is providing assistance to New Yorkers during the COVID-19 crisis by delivering meals to those who cannot access food themselves.
This website and assistance is intended for individuals and families who meet the following criteria as a result of the COVID-19 emergency.

ul.li: No members of the household can go out and get food
No neighbors or family members can go out and get food for the individual/family
Do not receive meal assistance from other providers (incl. Meals on Wheels or God's Love We Deliver)
Are unable to afford meal delivery or grocery delivery

div.div: For any student families without internet access, it is now available through Comcast for free for the duration of the pandemic. Click here to learn more about it!

div.p: Click the link for a guide to using google classrooms with your child.
Click here for resources to talk to your child about the Covid-19.

p.span: For information on the nearest location for your child to pick up breakfast, lunch and dinner please go to this link:
You will be asked your address and other questions to give you the nearest city school.

div.aria-label: Icahn 3 Morning and Afternoon Bus Routes

h2.span: Icahn 3 Morning and Afternoon Bus Routes

div.p: Parents! We will be using Pioneer and Grandpa Bus Companies for bus routes this year.
Need to contact the bus company?
Pioneer Bus Company: (718) 931-5450
Grandpa's Bus Company: (718) 409-4600

p.strong: Icahn Charter School 3 is excited to announce that it will participate in the American Debate League in the 2019-2020 school year. Students are given the opportunity to develop debating, speaking and literacy skills through debate training and competitions. Congratulations to our students for receiving 1st Place at the Debate Championship.

div.aria-label: Icahn 3 announces "Awareness Days" for the 2019-2020 School Year

h2.span: Icahn 3 announces "Awareness Days" for the 2019-2020 School Year

div.p: This school year we are excited to continue our “Awareness Days.” The purpose of “Awareness Days” is to foster a sense of unity, friendship and positive energy within the school environment. On “Awareness Days” students and staff are welcome to wear non-dress code honoring the monthly “awareness color” or costume. “Awareness Day Calendar” is coming soon.
Our Family Science Day will be held on Saturday, May 9th. Come learn all about science and engineering topics. Begins at 9:00 am.

div.h3:
The mission of Icahn Charter Schools is to use the Core Knowledge curriculum, developed by E.D. Hirsch, to provide students with a rigorous academic program offered in an extended day/year setting. Students will graduate armed with the skills and knowledge to participate successfully in the most rigorous academic environments, and will have a sense of personal and community responsibility.
Mr. Jeffrey Litt, Superintendent

New York City has updated the school immunization requirements for the 2019-2020 school year. Click here for a list of the new school immunization requirements for 2019-2020 school year. Before the school year begins, you must submit proof of all immunizations.
